teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising

teams.name: rockroom
teams.loan_because: As a community of wine lovers getting together to make and share wine, we appreciate the chance to join a community of lenders funding the entrepreneurial dreams of the developing world.
teams.description: Rockroom Winemaking Cooperative makes super-premium wine for ourselves and our growing circle of friends.

teams.name: Boulder Business Builders
teams.loan_because: As fellow business owners we want to encourage entrepreneurship and self reliance in emerging markets all over the world.  Business owners supporting other business owners.
teams.description: We are business owners that meet monthly to share business ideas and help encourage each other with referrals and advice.

teams.name: Animal Lovers
teams.loan_because: Even as animals living in a developed country - we are better off  than humans in many parts of the world.
teams.description: We are animal lovers who want to help those less fortunate in the poor areas of the world.

teams.name: Cheeseheads For Change
teams.loan_because: If you give a man a fish, you feed him for a day.  Now in the modern world, you can give that same man a loan to buy a fishing pole, he catches fish with his new pole to feed his family, his community improves because of his financial success, he pays the loan back, and  you can re-loan that money again to help someone else buy a fishing pole . . . wait, that sounds like a conspiracy by the Rapala Corporation to sell more fishing equipment, what are we supporting here ;-)
teams.description: Our Kiva lending team is a non-political group consisting of Green Bay Packers fans lovingly known as Cheeseheads, and anyone who lives in or has ties to the great state of Wisconsin and is interested in making the world a better place.

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising
teams.description: We're Canadian, eh?

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: Team Pakistan
teams.loan_because: we want to share what we have with those less fortunate
teams.description: Believe that everyone should should have an opportunity to improve their lives

teams.name: Calgary, Canada
teams.loan_because: Living in such a great city as Calgary with all the opportunities that entails, surely we can make an effort to help others less fortunate. We all can make a big difference with just a small loan.
teams.description:
This team is for residents of Calgary, former residents, people wtih friends and family here or for anyone who really loves the city!

To those who do not wish to receive an email when messages are posted to the board, there is a simple fix: Go to your portfolio, then your account, then email preferences and you can disable/enable from there. I myself have turned it off as I am a member of several groups and do not want to receive masses of emails.

teams.name: LOTUS: Lend Out To Uplift Self-sufficiency
teams.loan_because: We care about people striving to enhance their economic self-sufficiency and wish to support their entrepreneurial endeavors. It just takes one small step by each of us lending on kiva. Together we can make it easier for hard working people to get the much-needed capital to sustain and grow their business. We feel blessed to be able to support the aspirations of so many loan recipients who persevere tenaciously for a better quality of life with dignity. Kudos to Kiva.org that allows us to connect for this common cause.
teams.description:
In our team, we have a vision to change lives in novel ways. Our team's origin began with a Kiva Card (gift certificate) whose recipient founded this team. Inspired by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman's talk, our founder dreamed to take us on a cruise, beyond the realm of lending targets and team statistics. Frequent & occasional lenders are free to choose who to lend to, how much and when in an amiable team ambience nurtured by Kiva Fellows, Kiva Editor & Translators, artists, writers, entrepreneurs, workers, retired people, families, parent + kid(s), students, teachers, and professionals. Our diversity & portfolio enable our discovery of social values inherent in the Kiva micro-lending ecosystem whose issues we debate objectively. Experienced members are gratified to enhance our grasp of nuances in lending. We wish to work with volunteers in the team, Kiva Friends, http://kivafriends.org and our supporters to engage in activities that promote Kiva. Our journey to strengthen and grow the Kiva ecosystem has room for more. JOIN NOW, and check out our team, to convince yourself that it can be your team too.

LINKS TO SEE ALSO:
1. Kiva Updates:http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva 
2. KF Blogs:http://www.kiva.org/updates/fellows 

(Thanks Anh D Pham for letting LOTUS team on Kiva to use the exquisite image of the lotus flower you photographed in Vietnam)

The Parliament of Canada has recognized the Québécois as a nation. The largest city in Québec is Montréal, and the capital is also called Québec (Quebec City). The official language of Québec is French.

If you'd like to come and visit us, the official tourism site of the Québec government is at http://www.bonjourquebec.com

teams.name: Vegetarians and Vegans on Kiva
teams.loan_because: We have a vision of a healthier, more compassionate and sustainable world. Hard work is often not enough to escape poverty and we gladly welcome the opportunity to give people and their businesses a fighting chance. Our team focus is on making loans to borrowers who don't use animals in their businesses.
teams.description: We're vegetarians and vegans, and those thinking about making the change.  We welcome everyone regardless of their motivation for going veggie.

teams.name: Vegans for Peace and Harmony
teams.loan_because: we want to support non-animal businesses in under-served areas around the world. By doing this, we can show that you don't have to destroy the environment or murder sentient beings in order to make a living.
teams.description: Out to prove by example that you can end world hunger, save the environment, stop cruelty, end the energy crisis, prevent oil spills, end the health care crisis, end the dominance of big pharma, and be healthy just by being VEGAN...

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: Green Partnerships
teams.loan_because: We want to help create more sustainable and equitable communities all around the world.
teams.description:
We lend to individuals and groups engaged in businesses and services that help them earn a living but also help to protect the environment in their part of the world. We also strive to build green partnerships in our own communities by supporting the women and men who provide businesses, services, and products that benefit people and the Earth. 

Some of our team members mainly fund green loans, while others choose to designate a fraction of their loans to green enterprises. These are examples of just some of the loans Green Partnerships has helped to fund:

teams.name: Amy Poehler's Smart Girls
teams.loan_because: You change the world one kindness at a time.
teams.description: Amy Poehler's Smart Girls knows there is still inequality all over the world. The basis of that inequality is that you are being denied the ability to be yourself. We must all be be able to make choices that can lead to a better life. Micro-loans make choices available.

teams.name: Solar Explosion
teams.loan_because: 1.5 billion people still lack electricity. Only a global solar explosion can change that and end poverty.
teams.description: We know if you really want to fight poverty, you start with distributed renewable power – harnessing the sun in your own backyard! Micro-solar technology already exists that can transform people’s lives. The problem is that banks are only financing the old model: centralized power stations and expensive transmission grids. We lend to inspire awareness, so microfinance does more and more solar financing projects. Our goal is a solar explosion! Join us today!

teams.name: Supporters of Kyrgyzstan -Mol Bulak Finance
teams.loan_because: to learn, to help and to connect.
teams.description:
In the very heart of Central Asia lies a wonderful mountainous land – a country of Kyrgyzstan with the rich history that dates back to 201 BC. More than 80 ethnic groups live here, creating the variety of cultures and traditions. It serves as a trade crossroad and a trans-shipment point between the Europe and Asia as before when it used to be a connecting-link between north and south directions of Silk Way. 

The economy of Kyrgyzstan was severely affected by the collapse of the Soviet trading block. More than 20% of the Kyrgyz population has left to other parts of the Soviet Union within past 10 years to seek work.

While strong growth in neighboring Kazakhstan and China has created opportunities for expansion, Kyrgyzstan remains a small economy vulnerable to external shocks. Persistently high inflation, coupled with the global financial crisis, threatens to undermine recent improvements in poverty levels.

teams.name: Kiva Detroit
teams.loan_because: We want to champion small businesses in Detroit!
teams.description:
Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. 

The goal of the Kiva Detroit team is to empower Detroiters to champion local small businesses through Kiva. 

To double your impact, your loan to a Kiva Detroit borrower will be matched 1-to-1 by the Knight Foundation

teams.name: Team Europe
teams.loan_because: We think Kiva is a unique opportunity for people all over the world to assist entrepreneurs in improving their businesses and communities.
teams.description: We are European lenders (EU, EFTA, and all those who feel they belong) who share the belief in Kiva's vision.

teams.name: Kiva France
teams.description: Team of french kiva lenders

teams.name: Global Urban Trek
teams.loan_because: We have joined with the poor amongst the world and wish to continue to help our new found friends and family by helping to enable those in need in order to alleviate poverty.
teams.description: We are people who went on InterVarsity Christian Fellowship's Global Urban Trek--a six week mission taking college students to live and serve in slum communities around the world; seeking to love these people as Jesus does--and wish to continue serving our brothers and sisters.

teams.name: Alberta Canada
teams.loan_because: We want to help others in need.
teams.description: A bunch of good people trying to do good things for others~!

teams.name: Australia

Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,

teams.description: Team of the Belgian citizens & residents and of the fans of Belgian Waffles, Chocolate & Beers !

teams.description: A group of Kiva Lenders from Ireland, or with links to Ireland. Feel free to join our community :)

teams.name: ADEPT MINDED
teams.loan_because: TO ENSURE THE HELP IS PROVIDED TO ONES THAT NEED IT
teams.description: FOR THE GO GETTING MINDED, WHOM KNOW WHAT LIES AHEAD FOR ONES FUTURE, A MORE SATISFYING FUTURE

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Scream Team
teams.loan_because:
"Sometimes a scream is better than a thesis."                  

-Ralph Waldo Emerson
teams.description: Our favorite loans are to people whose facial expression or body language is better than a thesis.

teams.name: Ravelry.com
teams.loan_because: We want to support crafts people all over the world.
teams.description: We are a group of knitters and crocheters that want to support other crafts people around the world

teams.name: Northwestern University
teams.loan_because: We want to make a difference.
teams.description: Students, faculty, friends, and alumni of Northwestern University.

teams.name: Fandom!
teams.loan_because: We are awesome, and so is Kiva. Perfect match!

teams.name: Worldcon
teams.loan_because: as science fiction fans, we are committed to a better future.
teams.description: This is a group for members and supporters of the World Science Fiction Convention. It is not an official activity of the event but a personal initiative by convention members. The group was originally founded by members of Renovation, the 2011 Worldcon, but has now been made an ongoing initiative.

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: Atlanta Kiva Lenders
teams.loan_because: Atlanta cares! Spreading Southern Kindness Worldwide.

teams.name: The Wanderers
teams.loan_because: Micro finance rocks
teams.description: Wandering but not lost.

teams.name: Friends of Credit Mongol
teams.loan_because: We want to provide Mongolians with access to credit to improve their businesses, homes & quality of life.
teams.description: We support Credit Mongol and its mission to contribute to the prosperity of Mongolians.

teams.name: Washington State
teams.loan_because: Each of us has a responsibility to all of us.

teams.name: Hluvuku-Adsema, Mozambique
teams.loan_because: We believe that microfinance really can change lives and are excited about supporting the communities in the Matutuine district of Southern, Mozambique.
teams.description: We are ardent supporters of Hluvuku-Adsema and want to continually support their clients and the communities in the Matutuine district of Southern, Mozambique.

teams.name: RSA Fellows
teams.loan_because: For over 250 years the RSA has been a cradle of enlightenment thinking and a force for social progress.  Our approach is multi-disciplinary, politically independent and combines cutting edge research and policy development with practical action. And Kiva is practical action!
teams.description: Fellows of the Royal Society for the encouragement of Arts, Manufactures and Commerce (RSA)

teams.name: The Brights
teams.whereabouts: There are registered Brights in over 185 nations
teams.loan_because: The Brights is a constituency of individuals, each having his or her own reasons for lending.
teams.description:
A bright is a person who has a naturalistic worldview free of supernatural and mystical elements.  The ethics and actions of a bright are based on a naturalistic worldview. 

If your worldview is naturalistic, you are by definition a bright!

teams.name: HP
teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. It’s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

teams.name: GLBT (Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender) Kivans & Friends
teams.loan_because: We are out and proud and know what it is like to face barriers. We are privileged to help our entrepreneurs achieve their own equality. We thank our friends who join us in our loans & in supporting GLBT rights.
teams.description: We are gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, homosexual, and heterosexual people from all over the world.

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: Team Philippines
teams.loan_because: A little money can go a long way for people who don't have access to financial help.
teams.description: Filipino families and friends are caring, loving and daring to change peoples lives through financial support.

teams.name: 101 Cookbooks
teams.loan_because: There were nearly a million visits to 101 Cookbooks last month - a statistic that continues to amaze me. As the site has grown over the years, I kept thinking to myself that it would be great to figure out a way for us to affect change as a group - Kiva (with its team lending) is a great way for us to do that.
teams.description: Readers of Heidi Swanson's online recipe journal (blog) 101cookbooks.com

teams.name: India
teams.loan_because: "What we should aim at is the creation of people power, which is opposed to the power of violence and is different from the coercive power of state." - Vinoba Bhave
teams.description:
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty.

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe. We love India - therefore we are the Kiva Team India. We love to use the Kiva concept to provide loans in India ! http://www.kiva.org/india

Funding loans from India: http://www.kiva.org/lend?countries=IN

http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva/2012/08/15/kiva-launches-in-india.html

teams.name: LOTUS: Lend Out To Uplift Self-sufficiency
teams.loan_because: We care about people striving to enhance their economic self-sufficiency and wish to support their entrepreneurial endeavors. It just takes one small step by each of us lending on kiva. Together we can make it easier for hard working people to get the much-needed capital to sustain and grow their business. We feel blessed to be able to support the aspirations of so many loan recipients who persevere tenaciously for a better quality of life with dignity. Kudos to Kiva.org that allows us to connect for this common cause.
teams.description:
In our team, we have a vision to change lives in novel ways. Our team's origin began with a Kiva Card (gift certificate) whose recipient founded this team. Inspired by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman's talk, our founder dreamed to take us on a cruise, beyond the realm of lending targets and team statistics. Frequent & occasional lenders are free to choose who to lend to, how much and when in an amiable team ambience nurtured by Kiva Fellows, Kiva Editor & Translators, artists, writers, entrepreneurs, workers, retired people, families, parent + kid(s), students, teachers, and professionals. Our diversity & portfolio enable our discovery of social values inherent in the Kiva micro-lending ecosystem whose issues we debate objectively. Experienced members are gratified to enhance our grasp of nuances in lending. We wish to work with volunteers in the team, Kiva Friends, http://kivafriends.org and our supporters to engage in activities that promote Kiva. Our journey to strengthen and grow the Kiva ecosystem has room for more. JOIN NOW, and check out our team, to convince yourself that it can be your team too.

LINKS TO SEE ALSO:
1. Kiva Updates:http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva 
2. KF Blogs:http://www.kiva.org/updates/fellows 

(Thanks Anh D Pham for letting LOTUS team on Kiva to use the exquisite image of the lotus flower you photographed in Vietnam)

teams.name: Kiva Philadelphia
teams.loan_because: We believe in the power of empower.
teams.description: Kiva Philly was born in 2007, and has grown considerably over the years.

teams.name: Tire Lyna
teams.loan_because: We know what a difference it can make to lend even just a small portion of working capital to people in need.
teams.description: Tire Lyna's mission is to produce and market cost-effective, environmentally - friendly tire safety and casing solutions that help increase the productivity of our customers while decreasing the volume of tires being prematurely discarded into landfills each year.

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!

teams.loan_because: We believe in the generosity of the human spirit that is still alive within Americans of all backgrounds.

teams.name: Team California
teams.loan_because: Our state rules and we care about the world around us!
teams.description: We are from the great state of California!

teams.name: University of California, Santa Barbara
teams.loan_because: As college students, we recognize the importance and value of education and would like to do our part to improve the educational experience of others.
teams.description: University of California, Santa Barbara is a public school located on California's central coastline in a beautiful community.  Over 20,000 students attend the school.  The students take pride in both the excellent academics and active social outlets.

teams.name: Heartland Oklahoma Team
teams.loan_because: Oklahomans are always willing to lend a hand to our neighbors as well as to total strangers.
teams.description: An active team of Oklahomans joining together to fund loans, work toward goals, and have fun with Kiva loan challenges.

teams.name: Taiwan Gives
teams.loan_because: We love the world!
teams.description: Welcome all donors from Taiwan or who love Taiwan. >>  Ilha Formosa - meaning "Beautiful Island" in Portuguese ~ Taiwan Will Touch Your Heart.

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.name: Vancouver
teams.loan_because: We want to help.
teams.description: We are a group of people who want to make a difference in the world by helping those who have the desire and the passion to help themselves.

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising

teams.description: Believe that everyone should should have an opportunity to improve their lives

teams.name: Kiva Muslims
teams.loan_because:
002.271 Yusuf Ali Translation:
If ye disclose (acts of) charity, even so it is well, but if ye conceal them, and make them reach those (really) in need, that is best for you: It will remove from you some of your (stains of) evil. And Allah is well acquainted with what ye do.
teams.description: Insha'Allah our team will be a collaboration of people from all walks of life united by one goal: to help those less fortunate and displaying great appreciation to our creator for blessing us to help make a differerence in the world.

teams.loan_because:
We recognise our professional responsibility to give back to our wider community. 

We choose to support community organisations which build capacity at a local level and are sustainable in the long-term.

HDY is one of Australia's oldest and most successful commercial law firms, specialising in litigation, public sector and financial services. 
We are a team of over 380 legal, professional and support staff who value our working relationships, love where we work and excel in what we do.

teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

***TEAM WEBSITE***
http://apluskiva.wordpress.com/

***TEAM RESOURCES***
Secular Loans
http://goo.gl/wtDkJ

Field Partners - Social and Secular Ratings:
www.tinyurl.com/AASFSHNR-MFIs

***OTHER RESOURCES:***
Starfish List:
http://starfish.dynalias.org/

KivaLens:
http://www.kivalens.org/

KivaTools:
http://kivatools.com/

Toolkit for analyzing Kiva data:
http://build.kiva.org/

teams.name: New York
teams.loan_because: New York is full of entrepreneurs so we want to support others around the world, and give them the opportunity to alleviate themselves out of poverty.
teams.description:
We are a group of like minded New Yorkers who connect to make a difference.

Please note, Team Message unrelated to Kiva New York team lending & activities may be deleted.  Please keep posts related to the team!

http://gplus.to/kivany

teams.name: Gombe Thruhikers for Africa
teams.loan_because: We want help http://jgi.org Jane Goodall Institute save the world's chimpanzees, and to do so we must help the peoples of the world.
teams.description: We are just a group of normal folks trying to avoid the feeling of 'just me-ism, where one may think what can i do? I am just me, but many people doing just what they can do can have a huge combined impact.

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.name: Team USA
teams.loan_because: We believe in the generosity of the human spirit that is still alive within Americans of all backgrounds.

teams.name: Wharton
teams.whereabouts: worldwide, both MBA and WEMBA alumni and students
teams.loan_because: we care!
teams.description: Wharton MBA and WEMBA alumni is one of the most worldwide-widespread alumni group with a network of local clubs and expanding community worldwide. Let's make the most impact worldwide by creating Wharton affinity lending club and making the difference in the world.

teams.name: University of Pennsylvania
teams.loan_because: we are Quakers!
teams.description: "I do not pretend to give such a Sum; I only lend it to you. When you meet with another honest Man in similar Distress, you must pay me by lending this Sum to him; enjoining him to discharge the Debt by a like operation, when he shall be able, and shall meet with another opportunity. I hope it may thus go thro' many hands, before it meets with a Knave that will stop its Progress. This is a trick of mine for doing a deal of good with a little money." ....i.e. Pay it Forward.  -- Ben Franklin, in a letter to Benjamin Webb dated April 22, 1784

teams.name: España - Spain
teams.loan_because: Kiva ofrece un medio ideal para participar activamente en el apoyo a emprendedores sin recursos que no pueden acceder a los canales normales de financiación y que, gracias a los micro-créditos, pueden  desarrollar una actividad empresarial que les permita, a ellos y su entorno, alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
teams.description:
Este club se creó con la intención inicial de fomentar la participación de españolas y españoles en Kiva, no obstante,  está abierto a todas las personas que deseen unirse a él, sin importar su nacionalidad ni ninguna otra condición.
 
El único referente identitario de este grupo es la solidaridad y la convicción de que, a través de Kiva, es posible el apoyo a personas o grupos emprendedores que buscan y merecen una oportunidad por su esfuerzo.

teams.name: Credituga
teams.loan_because: we're just a bunch of good honest working tugas. So we don't have much to ourselves anyway. And this makes the whole thing much more interesting.
teams.description:
This team joins friends and co-workers, some of them have been brute forced into Kiva has there were no other available  way of making them understand that, as a good broke tuga, your destiny is to share with people with less resources. 
This was just the beginning...
 We invite everybody that shares the tuga spirit to join our team.

teams.name: Catholic Kiva
teams.loan_because: It is the right thing to do.
teams.description: Anyone is welcome to join our group.  The team is just for fun and to help build community.

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising
teams.description: We're Canadian, eh?

teams.name: Philippines
teams.loan_because: we want the world to become free from poverty. We will make this possible by offering poor people the possibility to move on by themselves and manage to climb out of poverty.

teams.name: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
Washington State
teams.loan_because: Each of us has a responsibility to all of us.

teams.name: Vegetarians and Vegans on Kiva
teams.loan_because: We have a vision of a healthier, more compassionate and sustainable world. Hard work is often not enough to escape poverty and we gladly welcome the opportunity to give people and their businesses a fighting chance. Our team focus is on making loans to borrowers who don't use animals in their businesses.
teams.description: We're vegetarians and vegans, and those thinking about making the change.  We welcome everyone regardless of their motivation for going veggie.

teams.loan_because: We have so much in America, and we must be our sisters' and brothers' keeper.

teams.description: We are Buddhists of all variety, but focus here is on the way of the Boddhisatva.

teams.name: Buffalo, New York Lending Group
teams.loan_because: We truly care about the people we help.
teams.description: We would like to represent to the world the generosity and caring that is so prevalent in Buffalo and Western New York.

teams.name: Maria Shriver + A Woman's Nation
teams.loan_because: For as little as $25, we can help women entrepreneurs right in our own backyard.
teams.description:
Continuing what she began as First Lady of California, Maria Shriver and A Woman’s Nation are partnering with Kiva, the world's first person-to-person microlending website, to empower thousands of women across America to become more financially independent. Our partnership shows that every loan you make to a woman entrepreneur – even $25 – will make a real difference. 

As "The Shriver Report: A Woman’s Nation Pushes Back from the Brink"* states, 1 in 3 American women lives on or near the brink of poverty. By starting or expanding her own business, a woman can lift herself and her family off the brink. JOIN US in moving women and families forward!

A Woman’s Nation™ is a nonprofit organization founded by Maria Shriver that imagines a new way forward for women and men, girls and boys. Through its multimedia initiatives and innovative partnerships, A Woman's Nation informs, inspires, and implements bold ideas into action with the goal of creating a culture where all lives and all work are respected, recognized, and valued. To learn more please visit AWomansNation.org.
 
* A project of A Woman's Nation, produced in partnership with Center for American Progress.

teams.name: Vegetarians and Vegans on Kiva
teams.loan_because: We have a vision of a healthier, more compassionate and sustainable world. Hard work is often not enough to escape poverty and we gladly welcome the opportunity to give people and their businesses a fighting chance. Our team focus is on making loans to borrowers who don't use animals in their businesses.
teams.description: We're vegetarians and vegans, and those thinking about making the change.  We welcome everyone regardless of their motivation for going veggie.

teams.name: Disabled Persons
teams.loan_because: This is a community of people interested in making a difference for entrepreneurs  and families who are affected by illness or physical, intellectual, or psychiatric disability.  We also support caregivers, entrepreneurs involved in the medical profession and anyone who is touched in any way by disabilities, chronic illnesses or one time medical needs.
teams.description:
Anyone who has an interest in disability issues or rights may join our team. This team was started as a way to find and keep track of Kiva entrepreneurs who are affected by illnesses or disabilities so that we might see what kind of difference we are making in the lives of these entrepreneurs. 

This team was originally created by a group of KivaFriends, but has always been open to anyone.  If you are interested, you can read about the team history here:

teams.name: Paying It Forward
teams.loan_because: We feel our lives have benefitted from the generosity of others and want to "Pay It Forward' by helping others through Kiva loans.  Join us if you want to return some favours to the world.
teams.description: The cost of one 'dinner out for two' is enough for people working their way out of poverty to have the chance to improve their lives. Repaid loans can continue to be relent over and over into the future, helping many hundreds in our lifetimes.

teams.name: Arizona State University (ASU) Students/Alumni
teams.loan_because: We're Devils that care!
teams.description: College students and alumni of ASU who donate to Kiva.org

teams.name: House of Xtravaganza
teams.whereabouts: The District of Columbia and Outlying Areas
teams.loan_because: No lady is sure at night.

teams.name: Atlassian
teams.description: Atlassian employees who use Kiva to support the world's smallest entrepreneurs, gathering together online.

teams.name: First Line
teams.loan_because: The ones who do not back down when everybody else does, deserves to make a decent living with financial security for their families.
teams.description:
We lend to entrepreneurs who are first line responders like firefighters, paramedics, police, rescueworkers and securityguards. Or people related to one by marriage - also widowed.

We, the lenders comes from all over the world, and lend to this group for our own individual risons. - Some of us to support colleagues, some just to support. Some in grattitude for service recieved. Yet some in grattitude that these underpayed and underappreciated people are out there, if we ever experience an emergency.

Welcome, if you like to join.

teams.name: Teachers for Change
teams.loan_because: "A hundred years from now, it will not matter what kind of car I drove, what kind of house I lived in, how much money I had in the bank...but the world may be a better place because I made a difference in the life of a child."
teams.description: "We all teach citizenship and caring with everything we do. This group is going to allow us to show it in force. No Child Left Behind taken to the higher level, out of politics and into concern for all the families of our global neighborhood."  -A Team member

teams.name: Kiva Jews
teams.loan_because: Tikkun Olam - making the world a better place.
teams.description: One of Judaism's most famous scholars, Maimonides, said that the highest form of charity is to help someone no longer need charity - and lending to Kiva does that.

teams.name: Goons Without Borders
teams.description: SomethingAwful.com lending group.

teams.name: Girl Guides and Girl Scouts
teams.loan_because: We want to help women and girls and their families around the world.  We already help as an organization and we want to help more by loaning through KIVA as well.
teams.description:
The World Association of Girl Guides and Girl Scouts is a worldwide Movement providing non-formal education where girls and young women develop leadership and life skills through self-development, challenge and adventure. Girl Guides and Girl Scouts learn by doing.  

The World Association brings together Girl Guiding and Girl Scouting Associations in 145 countries across the globe.

teams.name: USC Marshall School of Business
teams.loan_because: Trojans believe in a better tomorrow
teams.description: Past, Present, and Future Marshall students/grads

teams.name: Kiva Detroit
teams.loan_because: We want to champion small businesses in Detroit!
teams.description:
Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. 

The goal of the Kiva Detroit team is to empower Detroiters to champion local small businesses through Kiva. 

To double your impact, your loan to a Kiva Detroit borrower will be matched 1-to-1 by the Knight Foundation

So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

teams.name: Kiva Muslims
teams.loan_because:
002.271 Yusuf Ali Translation:
If ye disclose (acts of) charity, even so it is well, but if ye conceal them, and make them reach those (really) in need, that is best for you: It will remove from you some of your (stains of) evil. And Allah is well acquainted with what ye do.
teams.description: Insha'Allah our team will be a collaboration of people from all walks of life united by one goal: to help those less fortunate and displaying great appreciation to our creator for blessing us to help make a differerence in the world.
